title.narrative: HEALTHY LIFESTYLES & MENTAL HEALTH

description.narrative: Youth-friendly health and socio-pedagogical services are better oriented towards vulnerable adolescents, have greater outreach and cover mental health issues, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Evaluation, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women (Covid), Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Research, Supply And Logistics, Supply And Logistics (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children, adolescents and youth are better protected more socially included, prepared for the employment challenges of the future, and engaged in issues of their concern

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Youth-friendly health and socio-pedagogical services are better oriented towards vulnerable adolescents, have greater outreach andcover mental health issues

description.narrative: With the pandemic remaining a critical issue in 2021, the CO focused on health system strengthening in effective COVID-19 prevention and response of crisis psychological conditions among frontline health workers and adolescents. Access to the online psychological counselling was widened through the development of the e-mental health platform for adolescents. The improvement of the YFHC outreach services to adolescents practicing risky behaviours, supporting the enabling environment and empowerment of adolescents and young people living with HIV in their active participation in reproductive health activities, peer support and adherence to ARVs were also addressed. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2022
